card_answer:
###To advertise is to describe or draw attention to a product or event by using a public medium.

---

_The woman started a new company and needed to advertise her products._

###If someone is aware, they know that something or a situation exists.

---

_The student became aware that the teacher was watching him._

###A battery is an object placed inside something to supply it with electricity.

---

_My brother needs a battery for his clock._

###Black is the darkest color.

---

_Our street is black at night because there are no street lights._

###A city is a place where a lot of people live.

---

_Tokyo is a very big city in Japan._

###To clean is to make something neat and tidy.

---

_I clean our kitchen every Saturday._

###A country is an area of land with the same government and laws.

---

_France is a country in Europe._

###To develop is to make something larger or more advanced.

---

_This practice will help you develop your math skills._

###If something is electric, it uses electricity.

---

_Some car companies make electric cars._

###When something happens at a later time or in the end, it happens eventually.

---

_He will eventually move to London to find a new job._

###A fact is a piece of information that is true.

---

_A fact about South America is that it is a continent._

###Glass is a transparent, breakable material.

---

_Windows are made of glass._

###History is the study of the past.

---

_History was my favorite subject in school._

###Nature is everything in the physical world that is not made by people.

---

_On the weekends, I love to walk in nature among the trees._

###Never is when something is impossible or will not happen.

---

_They never eat meat because they are vegetarians._

###People are humans.

---

_How many people live in China?_

###Plastic is a material made by people.

---

_Many drinks are sold in plastic bottles._

###A problem is a situation when something goes wrong.

---

_My problem is that I lost my dog._

###A street is a road in a city or village.

---

_What is the name of the street you live on?_

###To think is to have an opinion or thought about something.

---

_I think summer is the best season._

###A person who is alone is not with another person.

---

_The boy wanted to be alone to think._

###An apartment is a set of rooms in a building where people live.

---

_She has a nice apartment in the city._

###An article is a story in a newspaper or magazine.

---

_Did you read the article in the newspaper about the soccer game?_

###An artist is a person who paints, draws, or makes sculptures.

---

_He went to Paris to become an artist._

###Someone’s attitude is the way they feel and think.

---

_John has a bad attitude. He’s always angry._

###Beauty is the state or quality of being beautiful.

---

_I heard my mother was a great beauty when she was young._

###To compare means to say how two things are the same and different.

---

_If you compare cats and dogs, you’ll see that they’re both good pets._

###To judge something is to say if it is good or bad.

---

_The boy was going to judge how his mother’s turkey tasted._

###A magazine is a regular publication with news, stories, and articles.

---

_She likes to read fashion magazines._

###A material is what is used to make something.

---

_Brick is a good material for building houses._

###A meal is a time when food is eaten, such as breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

---

_Breakfast is my favorite meal because I enjoy cereal._

###A method is the way to do something.

---

_One method to remember things is to tie a string around your finger._

###A neighbor is a person who lives near you.

---

_I like my neighbor because he’s very friendly._

###If something is professional, it deals with work that uses special skills.

---

_If you want to be a pilot, you must have professional training._

###A profit is the extra money you make when you sell something.

---

_I made a small profit from selling my old clothes._

###The quality of something is how good it is.

---

_The quality of his car is very good._

###A space is an empty area.

---

_I don’t have much space for things in my small house._

###Stairs are the things that are used to walk up or down in a building.

---

_You can take the stairs to the second floor._

###A symbol is a thing that stands for something else.

---

_This symbol tells us that we cannot smoke in this area._

###If someone or something is thin, they are not fat.

---

_The man was thin because he didn’t eat much._

###People study accounting so they can deal with money and finance properly.

---

_He works for an accounting firm._

###To appeal to someone is to be interesting or attractive.

---

_Sleeping all day appeals to me, but I have to go to school._

###To assume something is to think that it is true, even with no proof.

---

_I assume you are both familiar with this plan._

###To borrow something is to take it and then give it back later.

---

_Can I borrow a pencil to use today? I’ll give it back to you tomorrow._

###A client is a person or business that pays another to do a service.

---

_She has many clients who enjoy coming to her salon._

###The downtown area is the center of most cities.

---

_The downtown area is filled with many tall buildings._

###If something is dull, it is not exciting.

---

_The movie was very dull. I fell asleep watching it._

###To embarrass people is to make them feel ashamed or foolish.

---

_He was embarrassed when he couldn’t remember her name._

###A fare is an amount of money paid to use a bus, train, or taxi.

---

_Since he is a senior, my grandfather pays a low fare for the bus._

###Former describes something that used to be but is not anymore.

---

_The hotel, a former castle, was built over 200 years ago._

###To found a company or organization means to start it.

---

_The Pilgrims founded one of the first colonies in the United States._

###To invest means to use money in a way that will bring a profit later.

---

_I invested money in a new building that should bring me a profit._

###A loan is something, usually money, that one person lends to another.

---

_I got a loan from the bank._

###If something is practical, it is useful.

---

_Learning English is practical; you can use it in many places._

###A quarter is 1/4 or 25% of something.

---

_He paid a quarter for the candy._

###A salary is how much money a person makes at his or her job.

---

_He got a new job with a better salary._

###A scholarship is money given so someone can go to school.

---

_I got a scholarship to help me pay for university._

###If something is temporary, it exists for a short time.

---

_This car is only temporary; I’ll get a new one soon._

###A treasure is a collection of valuable things, especially jewels or gold.

---

_They became very rich when they found the buried treasure._

###To urge someone is to try very hard to get them to do something.

---

_He urged them to believe his story._

###A coach is a person who teaches sports.

---

_My coach gets very excited during games._

###To control something is to make it do what you want.

---

_To control the TV, just push the buttons._

###A description of someone or something says what they are like.

---

_I gave a description of the man with the gun and hat to the police._

###If something is direct, it goes straight between two places.

---

_The green path is a direct route to my house._

###An exam is a test.

---

_I did some practice questions for the math exam on the board._

###An example of something is a thing that is typical of it.

---

_Cola is an example of a soft drink._

###A limit is the largest or smallest amount of something that you allow.

---

_My mother put a limit on how much I could use the phone._

###If something is local, it is nearby.

---

_The local market in my neighborhood sells all the food we need._

###Magical describes a quality that makes someone or something special.

---

_The fireworks made the night sky look so magical._

###Mail is letters and other things sent to people.

---

_I get a lot of mail because I have friends all over the world._

###A novel is a book that tells a story.

---

_He wrote a great novel about ancient China._

###An outline is the plan for a story or essay.

---

_Before I wrote my essay, I made an outline._

###A poet is a person who writes poems.

---

_William Shakespeare was one of the greatest poets._

###To print something is to put it onto paper.

---

_Make sure that you print your name clearly._

###A scene is one part of a book or movie.

---

_A movie is made up of many short pieces or scenes._

###A sheet is a thin flat piece of paper.

---

_I only needed a single sheet of paper to do my homework._

###People who are silly show a lack of serious thought.

---

_I made a silly mistake of dropping mom’s vase._

###A store is a place where you can buy things.

---

_I picked up a few things at the grocery store._

###To suffer is to feel pain.

---

_Her headache made her suffer all day._

###Technology is new things made by using science.

---

_He loves technology such as laptop computers._

###To go across something is to go to the other side of it.

---

_He walked across the board to the other side._

###To breathe means to let air go in and out of your body.

---

_We need strong healthy lungs to help us breathe well._

###A characteristic is something that shows what a person or a thing is like.

---

_One characteristic of tigers is their black stripes._

###To consume something means to eat or drink it.

---

_Jack consumed a whole plate of spaghetti._

###To excite someone means to make them happy and interested.

---

_I heard about the school dance on Friday. This excited me._

###If something is extremely good, it is very, very good.

---

_I was extremely worried about him._

###Fear is the feeling of being afraid.

---

_I have a great fear of skateboarding._

###If you are fortunate, you are lucky.

---

_I was fortunate to get a seat._

###If someone happens to do something, he or she does it by chance.

---

_I happened to meet some new friends at school today._

###The length of something is how long it is from one end to the other.

---

_The length of the floor is three meters._

###A mistake is something you do wrong.

---

_My boss always yells at me when I make a mistake._

###To observe something is to watch it.

---

_Brian observed the sun rising over the mountains._

###An opportunity is a chance to do something.

---

_I had an opportunity to take pictures in the jungle._

###A prize is something of value that is given to the winner.

---

_I won a prize for getting the best grade on my science test._

###A race is a contest to see who is the fastest.

---

_Paul is a fast runner, so he easily won the race._

###To realize is to suddenly understand.

---

_After I left my house, I realized that I left the light on._

###To respond is to give an answer to what someone else said.

---

_When the teacher asked the question, we all responded._

###A risk is a chance of something bad happening.

---

_I took a risk and climbed the snowy mountain._

###To wonder is to ask yourself questions or have a need to know.

---

_The young mother wondered if she’d have a boy or a girl._

###Yet is used to say something has not happened up to now.

---

_We can’t go out yet; we’re still eating._
